intro: Chassalia parva, commonly known as the small chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a central disc of smaller florets. Chassalia parva is often found in coastal and inland areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
